resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kshitij12345 opened a new pull request, #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658

   Fixes : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17142

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#issuecomment-1190198758

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

kshitij12345 commented on code in PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#discussion_r925531310


##########
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:
##########
@@ -680,6 +680,9 @@ cdef class FileMetaData(_Weakrefable):
         -------
         are_equal : bool
         """
+        err_msg = lambda: ("Expected `other` to be of type FileMetaData"
+                           " but found " + str(type(other)))

Review Comment:
   Wrap it in lambda so that we construct this only when the assertion fails.

kshitij12345 commented on PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#issuecomment-1190200637

   cc: @AlenkaF @jorisvandenbossche

lidavidm commented on code in PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#discussion_r925764814


##########
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:
##########
@@ -680,6 +680,9 @@ cdef class FileMetaData(_Weakrefable):
         -------
         are_equal : bool
         """
+        err_msg = lambda: ("Expected `other` to be of type FileMetaData"
+                           " but found " + str(type(other)))

Review Comment:
   Why not just `if not isinstance…` and a regular `raise`? (assertions can technically be disabled.) And the idiomatic exception would be TypeError.
   
   Finally, I think Cython already enforces the type due to the annotation above, so it's just that we need to check for None.

jorisvandenbossche commented on code in PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#discussion_r925772233


##########
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:
##########
@@ -680,6 +680,9 @@ cdef class FileMetaData(_Weakrefable):
         -------
         are_equal : bool
         """
+        err_msg = lambda: ("Expected `other` to be of type FileMetaData"
+                           " but found " + str(type(other)))

Review Comment:
   > Finally, I think Cython already enforces the type due to the annotation above, so it's just that we need to check for None.
   
   Indeed, and we can actually also let cython check for the None by changing the signature to `def equals(self, FileMetaData other not None):`

kshitij12345 commented on code in PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#discussion_r925775606


##########
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:
##########
@@ -680,6 +680,9 @@ cdef class FileMetaData(_Weakrefable):
         -------
         are_equal : bool
         """
+        err_msg = lambda: ("Expected `other` to be of type FileMetaData"
+                           " but found " + str(type(other)))

Review Comment:
   > def equals(self, FileMetaData other not None):
   
   I didn't know that. Thanks! Will try that and update!

kshitij12345 commented on code in PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#discussion_r925779683


##########
python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx:
##########
@@ -680,6 +680,9 @@ cdef class FileMetaData(_Weakrefable):
         -------
         are_equal : bool
         """
+        err_msg = lambda: ("Expected `other` to be of type FileMetaData"
+                           " but found " + str(type(other)))

Review Comment:
   Updated :)

kshitij12345 commented on PR #13658:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13658#issuecomment-1192397207

   I think this should be ready. Mac CI failure looks irrelevant :)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
{code:java}
import pyarrow as pa import pyarrow.parquet as pq

table = pa.table({"a": [1, 2, 3]}) 

# Here metadata is None
metadata = table.schema.metadata

fname = "data.parquet"
pq.write_table(table, fname) # Get `metadata`.
r_metadata = pq.read_metadata(fname)

# Equals on Metadata segfaults when passed None
r_metadata.equals(metadata) {code}
fields.summary: [Python] Parquet FileMetadata.equals() method segfaults when passed None
